properties.name: 'St. Columba's Footprints'
properties.note: the impressions of two human feet and a date can be seen cut into the level surface of a small natural rock-outcrop.  Each imprint represents the rough impression of a shod right foot, and between them the figures 564 have been crudely incised in Arabic
properties.note_1: numerals are not likely to be earlier than the 16th century. The date of the southern footprint is uncertain, but it may be as early as the end of the 1st Millennium BC.

properties.inscription: This remnant of the ancient churchyard cross was restored ad 1900 in Memoriam R H J Gurney

properties.note: Believed to be a 'mounting stone' - to assist getting on a horse. Another possibility is that it's a 'stop' to rest a cart-wheel against to stop the cart rolling down the hill.

properties.description: Inscribed stone approx 0.6 by 0.75m in section and 1.45m high.  Inscription translates as [The stone of] Corbalengus.  [Here] he lies, an Ordovician.
properties.name: Dyffryn-Bern Stone

properties.description: f (on e) a (on w) with dy in small above

properties.inscription:
ST. VINCENTS CROSS
Formerly stood 15.25m due west of this stone. In March 1900 it was removed and re-erected 260m to the North at St Vincent's Cross Farm
properties.name: Original site of St Vincent's Cross

properties.description: Bronze age standing stone with Pictish symbols.
properties.name: Thief's Stone

properties.description: Flat stone on ground by roads through former RAF Chigwell base commemorating Operation Intone
properties.name: Intone Stone

properties.description: Stone marking the grave of an unknown Civil War rebel.

properties.description: Date unknown. Irregular sarsen stone set in the paving. Traditionally giving the locality its name. Transferred to present site in 1934.
properties.name: The Weald Stone
